cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.

cards.name: Venomoth
cards.text: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

cards.name: Spinarak
cards.text: Although the poison from its fangs isn't that strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

cards.name: Ariados

abilities.name: Hidden Threads
abilities.text: Your opponent's Pokémon VSTAR's attacks cost Colorless more. You can't apply more than 1 Hidden Threads Ability at a time.

cards.text: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

cards.name: Sunkern
cards.text: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.

cards.name: Sunflora
cards.text: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.

attacks.name: Bright Beam
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 70 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Serperior V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Noble Light
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Serperior VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Regal Blender
attacks.text: You may move any amount of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Star Winder
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

cards.name: Hisuian Lilligant
cards.text: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

attacks.name: Swelling Scent
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Foongus
cards.text: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.

cards.name: Amoonguss

abilities.name: Surprise Spores
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon is discarded from your hand by an effect of an attack or Ability from your opponent's Pokémon, or by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards, discard your opponent's hand.

cards.text: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren't washed off quickly, they'll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.

attacks.name: Hypno Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Durant
cards.text: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

attacks.name: Energy Digging
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Virizion
cards.text: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.

attacks.name: Four as One
attacks.text: If Cobalion, Terrakion, and Keldeo are on your Bench, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Chesnaught V

abilities.name: Needle Line
abilities.text: If your Active Chesnaught V is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Radiant Tsareena

abilities.name: Elegant Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.text: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.

attacks.name: Aroma Shot
attacks.text: This Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Scorching Breath
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Tackle
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: It can't run properly when it's newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Rapidash

abilities.name: Heat Boost
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. During this turn, your Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

cards.name: Victini
cards.text: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

attacks.name: Assisting Flame
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Reshiram V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sparkling Wing
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: White Blaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Braixen
cards.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

attacks.name: Flare Parade
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Serena card in your discard pile.

cards.name: Delphox
cards.text: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

attacks.name: Flare Parade
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Serena card in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Fletchinder
cards.text: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder's sharp talons finish it off.

cards.name: Talonflame
cards.text: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Litten
cards.text: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

attacks.name: Reprisal
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Torracat
cards.text: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it's feeling good. When it isn't feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

attacks.name: Gritty Claws
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

cards.name: Incineroar
cards.text: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.

attacks.name: Secret Attack
attacks.text: Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokémon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Flare Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: White Drop
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snow Mirage
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon that have an Ability.

attacks.name: Silvery Snow Star
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon V in play. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Omastar V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Primal Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon that evolve from an Item card that has "Fossil" in its name and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Tentacle Lock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Articuno
cards.text: It's said that this Pokémon's beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

attacks.name: Wild Freeze
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Gulp Down
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Wailord

abilities.name: Jumbo-Sized
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

attacks.name: Special Wave
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Feebas
cards.text: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon's marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Milotic
cards.text: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mellow Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Snorunt
cards.text: It's said that if they are seen at midnight, they'll cause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice to survive.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Glalie
cards.text: It has a body of ice that won't melt, even with fire. It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Big Mouth
attacks.text: If you played Candice from your hand during this turn, this attack does 130 more damage.

cards.name: Froslass
cards.text: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.

attacks.name: Frosty Jail
attacks.text: If you played Candice from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Relicanth
cards.text: Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders allow this Pokémon to survive the intense water pressure of the deep sea.

attacks.name: Fossil Finding
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 4 in any combination of Unidentified Fossil and Rare Fossil cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Phione
cards.text: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

attacks.name: Sea Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Water Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

attacks.name: Four as One
attacks.text: If Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion are on your Bench, this attack does 170 more damage.

cards.name: Dewpider
cards.text: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

cards.name: Araquanid
cards.text: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

attacks.name: Drowning Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Pika Strike
attacks.text: If 1 of your Dedenne used Dede-Short during your last turn, this attack does 180 more damage.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

attacks.name: Ambushing Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has used their VSTAR Power during this game, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Chinchou
cards.text: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

cards.name: Lanturn
cards.text: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Rotom
cards.text: One boy's invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom's unique capabilities.

attacks.name: Overhaul
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.

attacks.name: Lucky Find
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

attacks.name: Mystery Bolt
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have no Supporter cards in your discard pile. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zeraora
cards.text: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Battle Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Regieleki V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Switching Bolt
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Wall
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Regieleki VMAX

abilities.name: Transistor
abilities.text: Your Basic Lightning Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Thunder and Lightning
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Radiant Alakazam

abilities.name: Painful Spoons
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.

cards.text: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

attacks.name: Mind Ruler
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn't particularly like eating them.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Hypno
cards.text: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can't sleep at night in hospitals.

attacks.name: Psy Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Stage 1 Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Jynx

abilities.name: Selfish Lips
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon V, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

cards.text: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Misdreavus
cards.text: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn't deal well with folks who aren't easily frightened.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Mismagius

abilities.name: Spiteful Magic
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

attacks.name: Eerie Voice
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Unown V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shady Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Victory Symbol
attacks.text: If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card remaining, you win this game.

cards.name: Unown VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tri Power
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Star Cipher
attacks.text: Until this Pokémon leaves play, it gains an Ability that has the effect "The Weakness of each of your opponent's Pokémon in play is now Psychic. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)" (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

attacks.name: Memory Skip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

cards.name: Kirlia

abilities.name: Refinement
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

cards.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

cards.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Refinement
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

cards.text: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

cards.name: Mawile V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pouty Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chomp Down
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Mawile VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Rondo
abilities.text: During your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sudden Eater
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Meditite

abilities.name: Yoga Guard
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.

cards.name: Medicham

abilities.name: Chakra Awakening
abilities.text: If you have exactly 4 cards in your hand, this Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorlessColorless less.

cards.text: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Vigorous Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon VMAX in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Chimecho
cards.text: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.

attacks.name: Dreaming Tone
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if an Energy card is attached to the Defending Pokémon from your opponent's hand, that Pokémon will be Asleep.

cards.name: Sigilyph
cards.text: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians' emissaries.

attacks.name: Warning
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, you may put up to 5 Basic Pokémon onto your Bench in this way instead.

cards.name: Solosis
cards.text: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.

cards.name: Duosion
cards.text: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.

attacks.name: Cell Spear
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Persistent Cells
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile. (Discard all attached cards.)

cards.text: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

attacks.name: Cell Fork
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put 3 damage counters on each of them.

cards.name: Elgyem
cards.text: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

cards.name: Beheeyem
cards.text: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

attacks.name: Psychic Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Espurr
cards.text: Though Espurr's expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.

cards.name: Meowstic

abilities.name: Inviting Ears
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive than males. If they don't get what they want, they will torment you with their psychic abilities.

cards.name: Swirlix
cards.text: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn't get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.

cards.name: Slurpuff
cards.text: By taking in a person's scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It's hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: A Dedenne's whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.

attacks.name: Dede-Short
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if 1 of your Togedemaru used Toge Dash during your last turn. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Indeedee
cards.text: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.

attacks.name: Smart Service
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Dreepy
cards.text: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Drakloak
cards.text: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

cards.name: Dragapult
cards.text: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

attacks.name: Dragon Launcher
attacks.text: Discard a number of your Benched Dreepy up to the number of your opponent's Pokémon in play. Then, for each Dreepy you discarded in this way, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and do 100 damage to it. You can't choose the same Pokémon more than once. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Hisuian Arcanine V

abilities.name: Irresistible Force
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move a Fighting Energy from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rock Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Phanpy
cards.text: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Donphan
cards.text: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

attacks.name: Overspin
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Claydol

abilities.name: Mystery Charge
abilities.text: You can use this Ability only if you have no Supporter cards in your discard pile. Once during your turn, you may attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

cards.name: Anorith
cards.text: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.

attacks.name: Fossil Drop
attacks.text: You may discard an Unidentified Fossil card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Armaldo
cards.text: After evolution, this Pokémon emerged onto land. Its lower body has become stronger, and blows from its tail are devastating.

attacks.name: Reaping Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has 100 HP or less remaining, it is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Terrakion
cards.text: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cavern Tackle
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from attacks done to this Pokémon. If 1 of your Pokémon used Cavern Tackle during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

cards.name: Hawlucha
cards.text: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Sandygast
cards.text: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Palossand
cards.text: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.

attacks.name: Sandpot Trap
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Stonjourner
cards.text: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

attacks.name: Mystery Press
attacks.text: If you have no Supporter cards in your discard pile, this attack does 130 more damage.

cards.name: Ursaluna V

abilities.name: Hard Coat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Peat Shoulder
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zubat
cards.text: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

cards.name: Golbat
cards.text: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.

cards.name: Crobat
cards.text: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target's neck.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Critical Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow's presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Murkrow and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Honchkrow
cards.text: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Callous Wings
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Murkrow.

cards.name: Skuntank V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pursuit Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If that Pokémon retreated from the Active Spot during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shrieking Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.

attacks.name: Diving Uppercut
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Krookodile

abilities.name: Bully of the Sands
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard a random card from your opponent's hand. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.text: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile's mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mareanie
cards.text: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it's impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Toxapex
cards.text: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Morpeko
cards.text: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.

attacks.name: Peko Blaster
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if 1 of your Dedenne used Dede-Short during your last turn. This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Beldum
cards.text: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldum's sharp claws.

attacks.name: Magnetic Lift
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

cards.name: Metang
cards.text: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Metagross

abilities.name: Emergency Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, draw 3 cards.

cards.text: Because the magnetic powers of these Pokémon get stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross living on snowy mountains are full of energy.

attacks.name: Meteor Mash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Meteor Mash attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Radiant Jirachi

abilities.name: Entrusted Wishes
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

attacks.name: Astral Misfortune
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Ferroseed
cards.text: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn't very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

cards.name: Ferrothorn
cards.text: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

cards.name: Klink
cards.text: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Klang
cards.text: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon's rotation speed increases sharply.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Klinklang

abilities.name: Triple Gears
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.

cards.name: Cobalion

abilities.name: Justified Law
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Darkness Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Follow-Up
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Togedemaru
cards.text: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

attacks.name: Toge Dash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

cards.name: Magearna V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gear Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Special Laser
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dragonite
cards.text: It's a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.

attacks.name: Energy Hurricane
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Noibat
cards.text: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.

cards.name: Noivern
cards.text: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.

attacks.name: Radiant Hunt
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Radiant Pokémon.

attacks.name: Seventh Echo
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.

attacks.name: Shout of Power
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Regidrago V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Celestial Roar
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Laser
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Regidrago VSTAR

abilities.name: Legacy Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may discard the top 7 cards of your deck. Then, put up to 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Apex Dragon
attacks.text: Choose an attack from a Dragon Pokémon in your discard pile and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Smeargle
cards.text: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

attacks.name: Colorful Palette
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. You may attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Lugia V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Read the Wind
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Aero Dive
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Lugia VSTAR

abilities.name: Summoning Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may put up to 2 Colorless Pokémon that don't have a Rule Box from your discard pile onto your Bench. (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tempest Dive
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Ho-Oh V

abilities.name: Reviving Flame
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, attach up to 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Spinda
cards.text: Each Spinda's spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents' attacks brilliantly!

attacks.name: Dizzying Spin
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.

attacks.name: Continuous Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.

attacks.name: Magical Echo
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Buneary
cards.text: If both of Buneary's ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It's a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

attacks.name: Try Bouncing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lopunny
cards.text: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Archen
cards.text: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it's very good at jumping.

cards.name: Archeops

abilities.name: Primal Turbo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Special Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Hisuian Braviary
cards.text: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.

attacks.name: Eerie Cry
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Fletchling
cards.text: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.

cards.name: Brandon
cards.text: You can use this card only when it is the last card in your hand. Draw a card for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Candice
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Water Pokémon and Water Energy cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Capturing Aroma
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Earthen Seal Stone
cards.text: The Pokémon V this card is attached to can use the VSTAR Power on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

attacks.name: Star Gravity
attacks.text: Put damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon V until its remaining HP is 100. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Emergency Jelly
cards.text: At the end of each turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has 30 HP or less remaining and has any damage counters on it, heal 120 damage from it. If you healed any damage in this way, discard this card.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

cards.name: Forest Seal Stone

abilities.name: Star Alchemy
abilities.text: During your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: The Pokémon V this card is attached to can use the VSTAR Power on this card.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

cards.name: Furisode Girl
cards.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. You may switch that Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Gym Trainer
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 2 more cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Lance
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Dragon Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Leafy Camo Poncho
cards.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to the Pokémon VSTAR or Pokémon VMAX this card is attached to.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

cards.name: Primordial Altar
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may look at the top card of their deck. They may discard that card.

cards.name: Professor Laventon
cards.text: Put up to 3 Pokémon that have "Hisuian" in their names from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Quad Stone
cards.text: You may use 4 Quad Stone cards at once. • If you used 1 card, heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon. • If you used 4 cards, heal all damage from each of your Pokémon. (This effect works one time for 4 cards.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Serena
cards.text: Choose 1: • Discard up to 3 cards from your hand. (You must discard at least 1 card.) If you do, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. • Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon V with their Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Unidentified Fossil
cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play. This card can't retreat.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Wallace
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may draw a card. If they do, draw 1 more card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Worker
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Discard a Stadium in play.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Regenerative Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. Whenever you play a Pokémon from your hand to evolve the Pokémon V this card is attached to, heal 100 damage from that Pokémon.

cards.name: V Guard Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. The Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This effect can't be applied more than once at a time to the same Pokémon.

cards.name: Serperior V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Noble Light
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Chesnaught V

abilities.name: Needle Line
abilities.text: If your Active Chesnaught V is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Reshiram V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sparkling Wing
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: White Blaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: White Drop
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Omastar V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Primal Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon that evolve from an Item card that has "Fossil" in its name and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Tentacle Lock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Regieleki V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Switching Bolt
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Wall
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Unown V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shady Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Victory Symbol
attacks.text: If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card remaining, you win this game.

cards.name: Unown V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shady Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card remaining, you win this game.

cards.name: Mawile V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pouty Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chomp Down
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Hisuian Arcanine V

abilities.name: Irresistible Force
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move a Fighting Energy from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rock Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Laser

attacks.name: Aero Dive
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Ho-Oh V

abilities.name: Reviving Flame
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, attach up to 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Brandon
cards.text: You can use this card only when it is the last card in your hand. Draw a card for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Candice
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Water Pokémon and Water Energy cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Furisode Girl
cards.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. You may switch that Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Gym Trainer
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 2 more cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Lance
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Dragon Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Serena
cards.text: Choose 1: • Discard up to 3 cards from your hand. (You must discard at least 1 card.) If you do, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. • Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon V with their Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Wallace
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may draw a card. If they do, draw 1 more card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Worker
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Discard a Stadium in play.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Serperior VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Regal Blender
attacks.text: You may move any amount of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Star Winder
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snow Mirage
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon that have an Ability.

attacks.name: Silvery Snow Star
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon V in play. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Regieleki VMAX

abilities.name: Transistor
abilities.text: Your Basic Lightning Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Thunder and Lightning
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Unown VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tri Power
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Star Cipher
attacks.text: Until this Pokémon leaves play, it gains an Ability that has the effect "The Weakness of each of your opponent's Pokémon in play is now Psychic. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)" (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Mawile VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Rondo
abilities.text: During your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sudden Eater
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Regidrago VSTAR

abilities.name: Legacy Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may discard the top 7 cards of your deck. Then, put up to 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Apex Dragon
attacks.text: Choose an attack from a Dragon Pokémon in your discard pile and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Lugia VSTAR

abilities.name: Summoning Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may put up to 2 Colorless Pokémon that don't have a Rule Box from your discard pile onto your Bench. (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tempest Dive
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

abilities.text: During your turn, you may put up to 2 Colorless Pokémon that don't have a Rule Box from your discard pile onto your Bench. (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Gapejaw Bog
cards.text: Whenever either player puts a Basic Pokémon from their hand onto their Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Leafy Camo Poncho
cards.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to the Pokémon VSTAR or Pokémon VMAX this card is attached to.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.,Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

cards.name: V Guard Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. The Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This effect can't be applied more than once at a time to the same Pokémon.
